Jus Cogens.definition: a principle of international law that is based on values taken to be fundamental to the international community and that cannot be set aside

1.1: a principle of international law that is based on values taken to be fundamental to the international community and that cannot be set aside (as by treaty) [it is doubtful that any state has ever violated
1.jus cogens: norms on a scale rivaling that of the Third Reich "
